content.content: Welcome to Washtenaw Area Council for Children's Cyber Safety Exploration Module. In this module you will act as an advisor to a high school Sophomore, helping her make tough decisions with serious consequences. To learn how to play, click the 'Instructions' link below!
Instructions
assets/wacc-logo.jpg
Copyright Â© 2017 Washtenaw Area Council for Children, All rights reserved.
assets/mod2/hannah.png
Hannah is 16 years old, a distance runner on the Allatoona track team, and recently received her learner's permit.
This is a story where you get to choose the path the adventure takes. Links within passages show you image and video artifacts that provide context for what's going on in the story.
Links below passages are choices you can have the main character make. If you make a decision and want to change it, use the back arrow to the left of the text box.
Let's get started!
This is
Hannah
. She's a Sophomore at
Allatoona High School
. For Hannah, school isn't very fun. Her classes are really challenging and despite her best efforts her grades have been slipping.
Track, though, is another thing entirely. Last year she joined the JV track team and it totally changed her life - everything is so much simpler when she's running.
She has track practice pretty much everyday after school and when she gets home, she's usually exhausted. To blow off steam Hannah wants to do something relaxing. What should she do?
assets/mod2/snapchat-logo.png
assets/mod2/twitter-logo.png
assets/mod2/pinterest-logo.png
Hannah opens snapchat to see if anyone has updated their story. She notices she's gotten a
snap
from a girl named
Angelica
Hannah and Angelica aren't very close, but they've talked a few times. It's pretty cool that Angelica sent her a snap, but this one was really mean. Hannah wonders how many other people got it too.
What should Hannah do?
Tell Adam
Laugh
Ignore it
Hannah pulls out her phone and checks out her
feed
. It's been a while since she's gone on Twitter - there are a lot of hilarious tweets for her to check out.

Hannah usually tries to stay out of other people's drama, but Willa and Frankie's fights are usually too good to miss. They have some hilarious tweets, but this time it's starting out really personally. What should Hannah do?
Side with Frankie
Side with Willa
Report them
Hannah lays back in bed and idly scrolls through her
board
. Her pins are pretty much exclusively track related.

It's nice to take her mind off of school, but all the track pins remind her that if her grades keep slipping she'll be kicked off of the team. English is seriously tanking her GPA. She just doesn't get it.
Mr. Hoffman
To take her mind off of track she starts looking at other people's boards. There's one she sees where someone is takes different people's profile pictures and turns them into memes. There's even
one of Hannah
. What should she do?
Try and figure out who did it
content.linksTo: Try and figure out who did it

content.content: Report it
assets/mod2/allatoona.png

With a student body of over 2,000, Allatoona High School is the largest school in the county. Every sports team is a source of pride at AHS - the Allatoona Raiders have an undefeated football team this year.
It's kind of weird that Angelica would be snapping pictures of
Adam
. Hannah isn't sure if she's even seen the two of them talk before.
The snap is funny, but in a really mean way. Hannah would want to know if someone were talking behind her back, Adam probably would too. She decides to
text
to let him know what's going on.
Hannah goes back and checks out Meera's updates. As usual, they're hilarious. A few minutes go by before she gets a
text
from an unknown number. What should she do?
Respond
Ignore it
That snap was hilarious. Adam is one of the most annoying people Hannah can think of, so she doesn't feel too bad that he's getting made fun of.
Hannah also feels pretty good that Angelica is talking to her. Hannah was never popular, but she also wasn't unpopular. Having someone - especially someone as cool as Angelica - include her is great.
How should Hannah respond?
Send a snap back
Message her
A few minutes later Hannah gets another
snap
. This time it's of Hannah's best friend
Meera
. She doesn't want anyone to make fun of her friend, but at the same time she also wants more friends. Maybe Angelica could be one.
What should Hannah do?
Tell her to stop
Pretend to like it
assets/mod2/adam-snap.jpg

It looks like Angelica took a picture of her laptop screen. Adam does look ridiculous. He's probably trying to make it seem like a cool party, but it actually seems more like his little brother's bar mitzvah.
assets/mod2/angelica.png
Angelica is in Hannah's calc class. She's in the art association, on the yearbook staff, and drives a BMW. Everyone thinks she's incredible, but she's not exactly the friendliest person.
assets/mod2/adam.png

Adam isn't a very popular guy. He was really annoying in middle school and doesn't have many friends at Allatoona. He posts a lot of pictures of himself partying, but the parties all look suspiciously like they're in his bedroom.
assets/mod2/adam-text.jpg

Poor guy. He seems pretty upset. Hopefully he doesn't confront Angelica and tell her that Hannah gave him a heads up. Hannah wants to do the right thing, but would rather not be pulled into this drama.
assets/mod2/meera-snap.jpg
The infamous fedora picture. Meera didn't really discover her fashionable side until recently - this a few years ago this picture got a lot of attention on Facebook.
Hannah feels really good that Angelica sent her a snap. She always wanted to get to know her better. She decides to send Angelica a
snap
to show she can be funny too.

A few seconds later Hannah gets a notification that Angelica has taken a screenshot of the snap. Hannah feels torn. It's cool that she wanted to save it, but Hannah's not happy that she has a permanent copy of the snap.
Hannah and Angelica share a few more snaps and eventually Angelica asks Hannah to hang out after school. Hannah skips track practice and instead goes to get coffee with Angelica.
Hannah has a really good time talking with Angelica - she can't remember the last time she laughed so much. The two spend most of the time talking about people they don't like.
Naturally the two get to talking about their teachers and eventually
Mr. Hoffman
is brought up. Angelica //hates// him. Apparently he picks on her all the time. Angelica is planning on making a fake Facebook account pretending to be him. She asks Hannah if she'll help her.
What should Hannah do?
Help Angelica
Report her
Hannah decides to
direct message
Angelica. The two talk for a while and eventually Angelica asks Hannah to hang out after school. Hannah skips track practice and instead goes to get coffee with Angelica.
Hannah has a really good time talking with Angelica - she can't remember the last time she laughed so much. The two spend most of the time talking about people they don't like.
They eventually get to
Mr. Hoffman
. Angelica //hates// him. Apparently he picks on her all the time. Angelica is planning on making a fake Facebook account pretending to be him. She asks Hannah if she'll help her.
What should Hannah do?
Help Angelica
Report her
Hannah decides to send Angelica a
direct
message asking her to stop. Meera is her friend - there's no way she's going to let someone get away with making fun of her.
She doesn't get a response, but a few minutes later Hannah gets a text from Meera telling her to check out Angelica's instagram. She posted this
picture
Something needs to be done. Hannah knows that Angelica is doing similar stuff to other people. It has to stop. What should Hannah do about it?
Collect evidence
Get revenge
Hannah sends a direct message back pretending to like it. She didn't know what else to do. It's messed up that she's sending mean snaps, but Hannah kind of wants to get to know her better.
The two talk for a while and eventually Angelica asks Hannah to hang out after school. Hannah skips track practice and instead goes to get coffee with Angelica.
Hannah has a really good time talking with Angelica - she can't remember the last time she laughed so much. The two spend most of the time talking about people they don't like.
They eventually get to
Mr. Hoffman
. Angelica //hates// him. Apparently he picks on her all the time. Angelica is planning on making a fake Facebook account pretending to be him. She asks Hannah if she'll help her.
What should Hannah do?
Help Angelica
Report her
assets/mod2/meera.png

Meera is Hannah's best friend. She's an amazing student, but she doesn't take things too seriously. To Hannah, Meera is the funniest person in the world - she's always got something to lighten the mood.
assets/mod2/yearbook-snap.jpg

Hannah gets out her Allatoona yearbook from last year. She flips to Beth's picture and writes a message. Beth is in line to be the Sophomore valedictorian, but she never seems to do anything aside from school work.
assets/mod2/angelica-text.jpg

Well, it looks like Adam talked to somebody about the snap. Now Hannah's going to have to deal with it. She really doesn't like getting messages from people she doesn't know. How'd this person get her number anyway?
Hannah decides to respond to the text. It already says 'viewed' at the bottom, so there's no use pretending like she didn't see it.
From their
conversation
it's clear Angelica is really mad. Hannah is a little worried: what if Angelica tries to get revenge?
That night before Hannah goes to bed, she gets a
text
from
Meera
. Well, it looks like her worrying was warranted. Why would anyone believe that she and Adam would hook up?
What should Hannah do?
Confront Angelica
Ask Meera for help
Get revenge

That didn't look good. Hannah doesn't want to text a number she doesn't know. It's probably Angelica, but Hannah doesn't really want to talk to her anyway. Angelica is probably mad she told Adam about the snap.
Hannah gets a
text
and it's pretty clear Angelica is mad. Hannah is a little worried: what if Angelica tries to get revenge - what did she mean when she said Hannah had a thing for Adam?
That night before Hannah goes to bed, she gets a
text
from
Meera
. Well, it looks like her worrying was warranted. Why would anyone believe that she and Adam would hook up?
What should Hannah do?
Confront Angelica
Ask Meera for help
Get revenge
assets/mod2/angelica-text-two.jpg
It was pretty obvious the text was from Angelica, but it never hurts to ask. Hannah doesn't like that Angelica implied she had a thing for Adam. Hopefully she was just joking when she said that.
assets/mod2/meera-text.jpg
Well this isn't good. Meera's being optimistic, but Hannah knows that tomorrow is going to be full of people whispering as she passes them in the halls.
The next day at school Hannah goes up to Angelica hoping to have a serious conversation with her. Unfortunately, Angelica just laughed it off - no matter how Hannah approached the conversation.
It seems pretty clear that telling her to stop isn't going to help. Maybe she should consider some other options.
Get revenge
Ask Meera for help
After
texting
Meera to get some advice, Hannah feels like this is a pretty good plan. There's got to be a lot of things online that she can use to prove Angelica's hurting people online.
Hannah feels ready to
Collect evidence
Enough is enough. Let's see if Angelica likes it when people talk behind //her// back. Hannah needs something really good. What should Hannah do?
photoshop her picture
hack her phone
Troll her Instagram account
assets/mod2/pinterest.jpg
Hannah loves Pinterest! Whether it's finding motivational pictures or cool new running shoes, there's always something interesting to see.
assets/mod2/hoffman.png
Mr. Hoffman is Hannah's English teacher. He's known for making a lot of jokes - some of them at his student's expense. He's always been nice to Hannah, though.
It's pretty obvious that Angelica thinks she looks good. She posts so many pictures on Instagram it's not even funny. After scrolling through endless selfies, Hannah decides
this
is the pictures she's going to use.
After a few minutes of hard(ish) work, Hannah is admiring the
outcome
. The only thing left to do is post it for everyone to see. How should Hannah do it?
On her own Instagram
Anonymously on PostKandid
What is Angelica's passcode?
try 0000
try 1234
try 2001
Angelica spends so much time on instagram it's ridiculous - trolling her account is probably the best way to get on her nerves.

Angelica has over a thousand followers, so it's pretty obvious she accepts requests from people she doesn't know. Hannah carefully creates a fake profile she adds a few pictures to make the account believable. She sends a follower request and waits for Angelica to accept it.
An hour or so later her request is accepted! Hannah then proceeds to spam all of Angelica's posts with hateful messages like
this one
Hannah feels content with her work. She sits back and relaxes. A few hours later she checks to see if Angelica has made and new posts, but she realizes she's been blocked!
If she tries to make another account she'll probably just get blocked again. What should Hannah try this time?
hack her phone
photoshop her picture
assets/mod2/angelica-photoshop.png
It's not perfect, but someone out there will think it's real. Besides, it's more about sending a message than anything else.
Hannah's not afraid of Angelica. She's not the kind of person who would sneak around when she wants to get revenge, either. She's an upfront person.
Hannah posts the picture to her Instagram profile, tags Angelica, and waits for people to react. It isn't long before people start liking it and making comments.
With each person that likes her post, Hannah feels better and better.
Unfortunately, the next day at school she's approached by
Mr. Grant
. This can't be good.
When they get to his office, Mr. Grant asks Hannah if there's anything she wants to tell him.
What should Hannah do?
Come clean
Say she didn't do anything

PostKandid isn't nearly as popular as it was in middle school, but for some reason, there are still a good number of people who use it at Allatoona. Overall, fewer people will see the post, but that's the trade off for anonymity.
After making her
post

, Hannah decides to turn in for the night. She wakes up late in the morning and in the rush to get ready to school she completely forgets about her post from last night. She's reminded of it on the bus to school when Meera asks her if she was the one who made the post. Should Hannah tell the truth?
Yes
No
assets/mod2/angelica-two.jpg
This is a great one. It'll be pretty easy to photoshop.
assets/mod2/anonymous.png
After a few minutes the post starts to get some attention. Pretty soon someone will crosspost it to another social media platform and then everyone will see it.

Hannah comes clean and tells Meera the truth. She tells her all about how she crafted the post and how good it felt to be mean to Angelica. The entire time Hannah tells her the details, Meera has a disapproving look on her face.
Meera is pretty cold towards Hannah for the rest of the bus ride, and she doesn't show up to sit with Hannah at lunch. It's pretty obvious that Hannah's actions have upset her.
On the bus home Meera tells Hannah that she reported her to school administration.
How could she do this?! What should Hannah do?
Ask why she did it
Yell at Meera
Hannah lies and asks Meera what she's talking about. Meera shows her the picture. Hannah's plan is working - someone has already posted it on instagram.
If Meera didn't believe Hannah, she's not calling her out on it. During school Hannah overheard a couple people talking about the post. Hannah felt weirdly proud that people liked her work.

Angelica has definitely seen the post. She looked angry the whole day. Someone called her a caveman in class and she ran out crying. Hannah was actually surprised she took it so seriously - it kind of seems like Angelica doesn't care about anything.
Should she talk to Angelica?
Nes
No
assets/mod2/meera-text-two.jpg
This is great! Even though it would be great to see Angelica's face after making a post, this definitely feels like the right thing to do.

This module was intended to illustrate the ease in which people can get caught up in cyberbullying - whether it's a way of getting revenge, to make friends laugh, or to make yourself feel better. Nearly half of all teens are cyberbullied at one point or another - and there can be serious, long-lasting consequences. It's our job as a community to make sure there are as few instances of cyberbullying as possible.
There were definitely some better decisions that could have been made -
click here
if you want to make some different choices.
Visit ok2say.org to make a report if you or someone you know is being cyberbullied.
Thanks for playing our game!
assets/wacc-logo.jpg

Hannah goes up to Angelica during lunch. She tells Angelica that she was the one who made the post. Hannah also said she didn't mean to hurt her feelings so badly - she just wanted to make her think twice before making fun of other people.
Hannah thought that Angelica would appreciate her honesty - that maybe they could have a real conversation, but things didn't work out the way she planned.
Angelica got really angry and stormed off.
Mr. Grant
came into Hannah's next class and asked her to follow him to his office.
When they get to his office, Mr. Grant asks Hannah if there's anything she wants to tell him.
What should Hannah do?
Come clean
Don't say anything
Hannah's not going to comfort Angelica. If she can't handle getting made fun of, she shouldn't have made fun of other people.
After school, on her way to the bus, Hannah is approached by Angelica. She's so angry she looks kind of crazy. She accuses Hannah of making the post.
How should Hannah respond?
Lie
Taunt her
Hannah tells Angelica she doesn't know what she's talking about. She says she never made any post, but Angelica doesn't believe her.
She says she's going to report Hannah to school administration. Hannah's not sure if Angelica's telling the truth or not, but she's definitely nervous.
What should Hannah do?
Collect evidence
Ignore it
Hannah tells Angelica that it's too bad she can't prove anything. That night, there are lots of tweets about Angelica. Hannah
makes one
too. She's sick of Angelica pretending to be a victim.
The next day, when Hannah gets off the bus,
Mr. Grant
comes up to her and asks her to follow him to his office. This can't be good.
When they get to his office, Mr. Grant asks Hannah if there's anything she wants to tell him.
What should Hannah do?
Come clean
Don't say anything
assets/mod2/tweet.jpg
Sometimes you just have to call people out on their crap.
assets/mod2/grant.png
Mr. Grant is Allatoona's discipline administrator. He's ex-military, very patriotic, and the most strict person Hannah has ever met. If you're talking to him, you're usually in a lot of trouble.
It's pretty obvious Mr. Grant knows what's going on. Maybe if Hannah tells the truth she won't get in as much trouble.

Hannah tells Mr. Grant the whole story - starting with the snap she got about Adam. Mr. Grant says he believes Hannah, but without evidence there's not much he can do. Unfortunately he //does// have evidence of Hannah's posts about Angelica.

Mr. Grant tells Hannah that administration is going to look into her posts and in the meantime she can no longer participate in athletics. Also, depending on what they find, she may also be suspended! This is terrible!
The End
There's nothing Hannah is going to say - she's not going to admit  to what she's done. Unfortunately, she doesn't have to. Apparently someone showed Mr. Grant screenshots of Hannah's tweet.
Mr. Grant also showed Hannah screenshots of posts making fun of Angelica. Some were Instagram posts that Hannah didn't make and one was the PostKandid post.

Mr. Grant said he suspects Hannah made the posts, but there's not much he can do to prove it. He said that while it's being investigated Hannah can no longer participate in athletics - depending on what they find she may also be suspended!
Without any proof, there's no way that Mr. Grant is going to believe her when she says Angelica started everything! This is so unfair!
The End

The next day after school Meera drops by Hannah's house to help her collect evidence. They sit down on the couch, grab some snacks, pull out their laptops and brace themselves for the posts they're about to see.
It's not long before Hannah happens upon a
terrible post

Angelica made. How could she treat another person that way? It's not fair that Angelica treats people however she wants and never gets in trouble for it. Gathering evidence and reporting her definitely seems like the right thing to do.
After an hour of evidence gathering the two are ready to make their report. The only question is: should they make the report...
in person
online
Hannah felt nervous all evening. She could barely focus on her homework and she didn't feel like eating. Cyberbullying is illegal - what if she gets in trouble?
The next day, when Hannah gets off the bus,
Mr. Grant
comes up to her and asks her to follow him to his office. This can't be good.
When they get to his office, Mr. Grant asks Hannah if there's anything she wants to tell him.
What should Hannah do?
Come clean
Say she didn't do anything
There's nothing Hannah is going to say - she's not going to admit  to what she's done. Unfortunately, she doesn't have to.

Mr. Grant tells Hannah that someone has reported her as a cyberbully. The school administration is going to look into her posts and in the meantime she can no longer participate in athletics. Also, depending on what they find, she may also be suspended! This is terrible!
The End

try 1234
try 2001
Seriously? Her passcode is 1234? Angelica has got to be the dumbest person in the world.
Now that Hannah's in, she needs to change something. She goes in and puts her own phone number in the spot for
Brandon
. Now when Angelica thinks she's texting him, she'll actually be texting Hannah!
Luckily pretty much everyone has been spacing out in class. No one seems to have noticed Hannah's work.
That night after track practice she

Angelica.

Make Angelica think Brandon hates her

content.content: assets/mod2/brandon.png

Brandon is awesome. No matter what group you're in, Brandon is nice to you. He's friends with pretty much everyone in the school. He's also a really talented actor - he's been in almost all of Allatoona's school productions.
assets/mod2/brandon-text.jpg
This is perfect! It's so obvious that Angelica likes Brandon. There's so many ways Hannah can mess with her now!

name: Make Angelica think Brandon hates her

content.content: Hannah responds to the
text
in the meanest way she can think. It feels so good to give Angelica what she deserves.
The next day, after the morning announcements, she sees that Brandon's name is on the
honor court
list. Hannah's stomach drops. Could this be because of what she texted Angelica?
Hannah feels terrible all afternoon. How could she have not thought about how this would affect Brandon? in her last class of the day
Mr. Grant
comes into the class and asks her to follow him to his office.

Apparently, Angelica reported Brandon. When they talked to Brandon to get his side of things, they discovered that he wasn't the one Angelica had been talking to. It wasn't long before everyone figured out it was Hannah.
This is terrible! The punishments for cyberbullying people are really severe. Hannah could get suspended or kicked off of the track team!
The End

name: Make Angelica think Brandon likes her

content.content: Hannah
texts
Angelica back, pretending to be Brandon. She also emails school administration and says that she knows someone is going to Allatoona tonight at midnight to vandalize the school.
With any luck school security will catch Angelica going on school property and arrest her. This seems like the perfect plan. Hannah goes to sleep that night satisfied that justice will be served.
The next day, when Hannah gets off the bus, she's approached by
Mr. Grant
This can't be good.

She follows him to his office where he explains what's going on. Apparently, Angelica did go on campus at midnight last night and she //did// get caught. When she was explaining herself, though, it became clear that she hadn't been talking to Brandon at all.

It also became clear that tip school administration had received wasn't real. Now Hannah is in serious trouble. Impersonating other people and making fake reports are both punished very severely. Hannah might get suspended and kicked off of the track team! This is terrible!
The End
assets/mod2/brandon-text-bad.jpg
These messages are brutal. It's nothing less than Angelica deserves, though!
assets/mod2/brandon-text-good.jpg
This is almost too easy! Everything is going according to plan. Angelica is going to regret ever being mean to Hannah.

Allatoona has a system where students that get in trouble go to the honor court after the first class of the day. The point is for students to get a chance to defend themselves, but they almost always get punished anyways. Most of the time it's to discuss things like detention and referrals, but sometimes it's for more serious stuff.
assets/mod2/tweet-two.png
Angelica is such a jerk. That tweet wasn't even funny... It was just mean.
The next day Hannah stops by the office to talk to
Mr. Grant
. She shows him the different screen shots she found. Mr. Grant didn't do much talking, but at the end he thanked Hannah and told her that Allatoona takes cyberbullying really seriously.
He told her that the school administration was going to look into Angelica's behavior. Hopefully Hannah and her classmates can now go online without worrying about being bullied.
The End
Meera said something about a way to make confidential reports using
OK2Say
The two check out the website ok2say.org and find that it's really easy to provide the necessary information and link the screenshots they took of Angelica's posts.
It's also great because, for the time being, they won't have to talk to any adults about it. Also nobody will know who made the report!
The End
http://www.michigan.gov/images/ok2say/OK2SAY_School_485494_7.png
These Ok2Say posters are all over Allatoona. Hannah's never really noticed them or wondered what they were for. Good thing Meera was paying attention.

This module was intended to illustrate the ease in which people can get caught up in cyberbullying - whether it's a way of getting revenge, to make friends laugh, or to make yourself feel better. Nearly half of all teens are cyberbullied at one point or another - and there can be serious, long-lasting consequences. It's our job as a community to make sure there are as few instances of cyberbullying as possible.
In this case, making a report was the right thing to do.
Click here
if you want to go back and explore a different path.
Visit ok2say.org to make a report if you or someone you know is being cyberbullied.
Thanks for playing our game!

Hannah is really upset. Even though she's angry at Meera she tries to stay calm. She asks Meera why she would tell on her friend and the answer surprised her.

Meera is staunchly against cyberbullying - even against Angelica - because her older brother was severely cyberbullied. He couldn't go online without being harassed by his classmates. Any post he would make would immediately get filled with hateful comments. His grades dropped, he stopped talking to his friends and family, and became really depressed.
Meera doesn't want anyone, no matter how annoying, to have to deal with what her brother had to. She also didn't want to see her friend become someone so full of hate.
That evening Hannah's father tells her that he received a call from
Mr. Grant
. Tomorrow they have to go to a parent-teacher meeting to discuss what Hannah did.
She might get kicked off the track team or even suspended! This is terrible!
The End

Hannah can't control herself - Meera betrayed her! She yells at Meera in front of the whole bus. When she calms down. Meera tells her that she understands why Hannah is upset she also wants Hannah to know why she did it.

Meera is staunchly against cyberbullying - even against Angelica - because her older brother was severely cyberbullied. He couldn't go online without being harassed by his classmates. Any post he would make would immediately get filled with hateful comments. His grades dropped, he stopped talking to his friends and family, and became really depressed.
Meera doesn't want anyone, no matter how annoying, to have to deal with what her brother had to. She also didn't want to see her friend become someone so full of hate.
That evening Hannah's father tells her that he received a call from
Mr. Grant
. Tomorrow they have to go to a parent-teacher meeting to discuss what Hannah did.
She might get kicked off the track team or even suspended! This is terrible!
The End
assets/mod2/angelica-ig-post.png
Hannah spends almost an hour posting something on just about every one of Angelica's photos. Hopefully this will teach her a lesson.
assets/mod2/angelica-snap-dm.png
It seems like the easiest way to talk to some people is to talk about things you both hate - they both seems to dislike Adam. Hannah wonders what it would like to be friends with Angelica.
A fake account is a great idea. Since he's so old probably all of his friends are using Facebook. Also, if he's picking on Angelica he probably deserves it! The two get started on their plan!
By using the staff directory on the school website, the duo are able to create a fairly convincing and funny
account
for Mr. Hoffman. Angelica looks at Mr. Hoffman's real profile and begins sending friend requests to some of his friends.

Hannah starts to feel a little uncomfortable. Making fun of him and creating an account were fun at first, but now this seems like it could end badly. Hannah tries to ignore her instincts and just have a good time, but it's hard.

The next day at school Mr. Hoffman seems on edge. People are talking about the account too - apparently Angelica told some of her friends that she and Hannah made it. Hannah really hopes that it won't get out, but at the end of the day she's approached by
Mr. Grant
. This can't be good.
The two go to his office where he asks Hannah if she as anything to tell him. What should Hannah do?
Tell the truth
Blame Angelica

Hannah knows that for a report to hold any weight there needs to be evidence. The next day after school Meera drops by Hannah's house to help her collect some. They sit down on the couch, grab some snacks, pull out their laptops and brace themselves for the posts they're about to see.
It's not long before Hannah happens upon a
terrible post

Angelica made. How could she treat another person that way? It's not fair that Angelica treats people however she wants and never gets in trouble for it. Gathering evidence and reporting her definitely seems like the right thing to do.
After an hour of evidence gathering the two are ready to make their report. The only question is: should they make the report...
in person
online
assets/mod2/facebook.png
Making this profile with Angelica was pretty fun. Mr. Hoffman never bothered Hannah, but she believes what Angelica said about him.
It's pretty obvious Mr. Grant knows what's going on. Maybe if Hannah tells the truth she won't get in as much trouble.
Hannah tells Mr. Grant the whole story - starting with the snap she got about Adam.
Mr. Grant tells Hannah that impersonating someone - especially a school employee - is a very serious offense. Hannah is going to be suspended and removed from the track team. This is terrible!
The End
Maybe Hannah can pin this on Angelica, she planned most of it anyways. She tells Mr. Grant that Angelica was the one who made the account - she only watched.
Mr. Grant laughs and tells Hannah that Angelica said the whole thing was Hannah's idea. Seriously?!
He goes on to say that impersonating someone - especially a school employee - is a very serious offense. Hannah is going to be suspended and removed from the track team. This is terrible!
The End
assets/mod2/angelica-snap-dm-two.png
Hannah really hopes that standing up to Angelica will make her stop. She didn't want to call attention to herself, but when someone is making fun of her friends, she can't just look the other way.
assets/mod2/photoshop.jpg
Angelica has posted this picture with the caption "Hannah and her boyfriend." At this point Hannah isn't even hurt - she's just confused. This is really weird.
assets/mod2/meme.jpg
That only happened one time! It's not even a funny meme. Hannah is determined to find out who made these different images.

name: Try and figure out who did it

content.content: Hannah has so many questions: who's board is it? did the person who pinned the memes make them, or did they just find them? Why would somebody do this?
Hannah decides to go to her friend
Meera
for help. She sends her a
text
. It seems like there's way more cyberbullying going on than Hannah knew about. Hannah decides to check out the
Allatoona Exposed
Instagram page. This is really serious. There are so many embarrassing posts about people. Do they even know they're being talked about?
What should Hannah do?
Report it
Send a them a direct message
content.linksTo: Send a them a direct message

content.content: Ask around to see who is making these pages
content.linksTo: Ask around to see who is making these pages

content.content: assets/mod2/meera-text-three.png
Allatoona Exposed sounds like really bad news. What is wrong with some people? Why can't everyone just leave each other alone?
assets/mod2/allatoona-exposed.png
This page is pretty intense. There are dozens of embarrassing posts about people from Allatoona High - people that Hannah knows! Somebody should really do something about it.
Someone has to do something about this. On the way to school the next day Hannah talks to Meera about making a report.

Hannah's not sure who to report this kind of thing to. If she makes a report to the website they may not do anything about it. If she tells her parents they'll totally freak out - they may even take her phone away. If she goes the school administration people may find out she's the one who told.

Meera and Hannah talk about all the different gossip and bullying pages that they've heard about at Allatoona. It seems like there are dozens. Both agree that they have to do something about it. Meera has a great idea: if they get a bunch of students to come forward with them, the Allatoona administration will have to do something about it.

That day Hannah and Meera talk to pretty much everyone they know about whether or not they've been cyberbullied. It seems like around half the people they talk to have been bullied at one time or another. One of them suggests something interesting. All the people that have been bullied should make their own instagram page and get revenge by making posts about the people that bullied them.
Should Hannah help make a page like that?
Yes
No

name: Send a them a direct message

content.content: Hannah decided a direct approach would be best. She sent a
direct message

asking whoever made the page to take it down. Hannah would be lying if she said she wasn't nervous about that exchange. She decides to take a screenshot of the conversation and the exposed page just in case.

The next morning when Hannah turns on her phone she thinks something must be broken. She has 73 missed calls, 51 text message, and 130 emails. She looks at them - a lot are random spam, but most are hateful, threatening messages from bots, random instagram pages, and other throwaway accounts.
This must be related to the message she sent. Hannah is wondering how they got her number when she remembers: in her profile information she put her phone number and email! That was such a bad idea!
Her phone is buzzing constantly - she has to do something. What should she do?
Tell her parents
Ask administration for help

name: Ask around to see who is making these pages

content.content: Hannah is determined to find out who is making these pages. She talks to pretty much everyone she knows - and a lot of people she doesn't - asking about the meme board and the exposed page. A few people didn't know what she was talking about, but most did. In fact, lots of people said they check out the page from time to time.
No one seemed to know who made the page, though. Hannah was just about to give up when
Micah
approached her after school.

He had overheard that Hannah was looking for whomever created the Allatoona Exposed page. Micah said that he had also been trying to figure out who ran the site. Apparently his older sister had been exposed on the page. It completely ruined her life. She had to switch schools, she started therapy, and it seemed like she would never get over it.

Micah said he had figured out who had created the page. By looking at some of the photo's geotags he was able to find the address where most of the pictures were taken. Using whitepages he was able to find out who owned the house.
The person that created the page was
Tyler Giddings
. Micah suggests they get revenge - they should really scare Tyler for what he's done.
What should they do?
report Tyler
scare Tyler

The idea to make a slam page is really appealing. This is a chance for everyone that feels bullied to get revenge. This could be really big. Hannah knows she could get in trouble for doing it though, so she'll have to be smart about it.

Hannah makes a new an email account under a fake name. She then uses that account to make a new instagram profile. She makes the account private and then sends specific people follower requests with the username and password for the account. That way Hannah doesn't have to be the one to make all the posts.
In Hannah's mind, the key to not getting caught is to make sure there weren't too many people involved. She also didn't want it getting out that she was the one who made it.
Pretty soon her page was filled with posts. Some of them were
great posts
but Hannah started noticing
posts
she didn't like. It really seems like this site is getting out of control.
What should she do?
Report it
Ask Meera for advice
If Hannah makes a slam page then she's no better than the people who made Allatoona Exposed. It's better if she just reports the page.
Hannah was just about to walk into the office when
Micah
approached her.

He had overheard that Hannah talking  Allatoona Exposed page. Micah said that he had also been trying to figure out who ran the site. Apparently his older sister had been exposed on the page. It completely ruined her life. She had to switch schools, she started therapy, and it seemed like she would never get over it.

Micah said he had figured out who had created the page. By looking at some of the photo's geotags he was able to find the address where most of the pictures were taken. Using whitepages he was able to find out who owned the house.
The person that created the page was
Tyler Giddings
. Micah suggests they get revenge - they should really scare Tyler for what he's done.
What should they do?
report Tyler
scare Tyler
assets/mod2/ig-dm.png
Hannah hopes the person is just messing around. She doesn't want any trouble - she just wants people to be able to go online and not be afraid that someone will be mean to them.
Hannah doesn't know who else to go to. This is serious, she's starting to feel unsafe based on all these messages. How is she getting them from so many people?

When she goes into the kitchen her dad can tell she's visibly upset. She tells him the whole story about the different websites. To Hannah's surprise, he's really supportive. She wasn't sure if he would understand or not. He told Hannah to keep her phone turned off and that he would take her to the police station after school.

School is pretty rough today. Apparently, after she sent the message, whoever is running the page made a bunch of posts about her. Everyone seems to know that she's trying to get the page taken down. Somebody also wrote the word "snitch" on her locker.
Hannah feels terrible. It seems like everyone is looking at her - like everyone is talking about her. At lunch a freshman named
Jess
came up to Hannah. She thanked Hannah for trying to get the site down. She said she saw what other people had posted about Hannah and asked if she was ok.
Just one person checking in to see if she was alright made Hannah feel a million times better.
That evening Hannah and her father go to the police station. Hopefully, with their help, everything will end up fine!
The End
During lunch Hannah goes to
Mr. Grant's
office to explain her problems.

Mr. Grant seems very concerned at the news Hannah gives him, but he also asks for proof. Hannah is a little annoyed that he doesn't trust her, but at the same time she kind of understands the need for proof.

She shows him the various slam pages she's found and the messages she's received. He thanks her for bringing the information to his attention and says that the administration will do something about the problem.

When Hannah presses him for more information he says he can't tell her what they're going to do specifically. Hannah is frustrated, but she doesn't really have any other choice than to trust Mr. Grant will solve the problem.
The End
assets/mod2/jess.png
Hannah doesn't know Jess too well. They've had a few conversations and from what Hannah can tell she's really nice. She's heard some rumors that Jess has had her own kind of cyberbullying problems.
assets/mod2/boomerang.gif

This boomerang of Kyle is exactly what the site is for. He's one of the biggest bullies. Hannah doesn't know how the person got the footage, but she is so grateful she can watch him fall on an infinite loop.
assets/mod2/meme-two.jpg
This picture of Jackson is just mean - it misses the whole point of the site. The posts are supposed to make fun of people that deserve it. Hannah has never seen Jackson make fun of anyone!
Hannah doesn't know what else to do. She has to report it. At school she decides to go to
Mr. Grant's
office during lunch.

Hannah tells Mr. Grant about the different slam pages she's discovered over the past days. She even tells him about the one she made. Hannah feels so wrought with guilt that she could create something like Allatoona Exposed. It was a terrible idea.
Mr. Grant says that he appreciates her honesty, but there still have to be consequences. Hannah is afraid - she could get suspended and kicked off of the track team! This is horrible!
The End
Meera will definitely know what to do. After Hannah tells her everything she can see that Meera is really disappointed.

Meera explains that her brother was cyberbullied really badly. People were so mean to him that he became completely depressed. He didn't want to do any of the things he used to love, he rarely talked to his family, and he hardly even left his room for months.
Despite being disappointed Meera still wants to help Hannah solve her problem. She mentioned something called
OK2Say
. Hannah has seen posters for it all over her school.

Apparently it's a great way to make a confidential report. Hannah will enter in some information, attach some evidence, and then the right people will make sure the site gets shut down. In the meantime Hannah thinks it's a good idea to stay away from the site for a while.
The End
assets/mod2/mica.png
Micah is pretty quiet. He's not unpopular, but he never seems to hang out with anybody - he's definitely a loner.
assets/mod2/facebook-two.png
This is so creepy! That guy is 34 years old - why is he interested in getting pictures of high school students?
This guy clearly doesn't care about breaking the law. He doesn't seem like the kind of person you should mess with. Hannah convinces Micah that the smartest thing to do is to report him.
After thinking about it for a while Micah agrees. He suggests the two use
OK2Say
to make their report. The two visit the website, type a brief description of the problem, and attach the evidence they have amassed.
Making the report feels like the right thing to do. There's no telling what other misdeeds Tyler is doing.
The End
Someone like Tyler really deserves to be treated the same way they treat other people. Hannah and Micah figure out a way to hide their phone numbers and they each
text
Tyler the same thing.
It seems like Tyler is pretty freaked out. The two go home - satisfied that they have solved the problem.
A few days later, before school starts, they check - sure enough the page has been taken down. It worked! That afternoon, however, they're approached by
Mr. Grant
. He asks Hannah to join him in his office. He says that police have contacted him regarding Allatoona students threatening someone.

Hannah immediately gives Mr. Grant the whole story - what Tyler did was way worse than anything she and Micah did. Apparently Mr. Grant knew the entire story. After Tyler had reported the threats, the police did some research of their own. Even though he had deleted the slam sites, he had left behind some evidence of all the weird things he had been up to.

He was arrested, but that doesn't excuse the things Hannah and Micah did. The police have decided to allow school administration to handle the incident. This could lead to suspension and getting kicked off of the track team! This is terrible!
The End
assets/mod2/hannah-text.jpg
It feels kind of weird threatening someone like that. Hopefully this will scare him enough to delete the pages he's made.
assets/mod2/twitter.png
Looks like Willa and Frankie are back at it. Their Twitter beefs are legendary and have a way of drawing in a lot of people.
What
Willa
said to
Frankie
was seriously messed up. It doesn't matter what Frankie did in the first place - that got personal really fast. To show her support Hannah makes a tweet about Willa with #teamfrankie at the end.
A few minutes later she gets a
direct message

from Willa. What she said was surprisingly mean. Hannah always grew up thinking that it didn't matter what other people said, but this makes her think otherwise. She's never had someone actually try to hurt her.
What can Hannah do to take her mind off of it?
Go for a run
Scroll through reddit
Do her homework
Frankie
A few minutes later she gets a
direct message

from Frankie. What she said was surprisingly mean. Hannah always grew up thinking that it didn't matter what other people said, but this makes her think otherwise. She's never had someone actually try to hurt her.
What can Hannah do to take her mind off of it?
Go for a run
Scroll through reddit
Do her homework
Hannah doesn't know why, but it seems like this one is going to get out of hand really quickly. She reports
Willa
and
Frankie
A few minutes go by and she gets a
text
from
Brandon
. Hannah has been so bored recently - finally she has something to look forward to.

The next day school takes forever to end. Hannah and Meera are really excited to start their weekend off with a party. After what feels like days, they're finally on their way to Brandon's house. When they arrive Brandon's house is packed. There are lots of people from Allatoona - a couple of them seem really drunk.
Hannah and Meera see a bunch of people crowded around a corner. Somebody Hannah doesn't recognize is on the ground passed out. Everyone around him is taking pictures and videos. This girl
Angelica
already posted
this
to her snap story.
What should Hannah do?
Call 911
See if he's alive
Leave the party
assets/mod2/frankie_dm.png
Whoa. That was really mean. Hannah was just playing around - she didn't want to make Frankie mad. That really hurt.
assets/mod2/willa-dm.png
Whoa. That was really mean. Hannah was just playing around - she didn't want to make Willa mad. That really hurt.
assets/mod2/frankie.png
Frankie is in Hannah's english class. Anytime anyone who's not in her friend group tries to talk to her, she acts like she just wants to be left alone.
assets/mod2/willa.png
Willa is a junior at Allatoona. Hannah and Willa were in the same gym class last year. She always had a joke ready, which helped to make the class at least somewhat tolerable.

Nothing clears Hannah's head like a run through her town. She slips on her running shoes and heads out. When she runs, it's like her mind shuts off. She's able to stop thinking about things that bother her and getting exercise really helps improve her mood.
As she's running she passes by
The Metro
and decides to stop in for an iced coffee. She gets in line and notices she's behind
Adam
. Hannah really hopes he doesn't see her, but a few seconds later he turns around and starts to talk to her.
He says that he saw some of the mean posts about Hannah and asks if she's doing alright.
Wait, there are mean posts now? A direct message is one thing, but a post for everyone to see is really annoying. What is Willa even saying about her?
Should Hannah look at the posts?
Yes
No

Hannah goes on Reddit and scrolls through the frontpage aimlessly. She tries to focus on what she's looking at, but she finds herself reading the same comments over and over without actually understanding them.  Her mind is definitely elsewhere.
She can only imagine what other things Willa is saying about her. Should Hannah look at Willa's accounts to see what she's saying?
Yes
No
Hannah tries to do her assigned reading for English class, but it gets to the point where Hannah has read the same paragraph four times and she has no idea what it says.
She can't stop thinking about that message. What Willa said to Hannah was really mean. If that's what she's saying to her face, what is Willa saying about Hannah behind her back?
Should Hannah check Willa's different accounts to see what she's saying?
Yes
No
assets/mod2/metro.png
The Metro seems like the only cool place in Hannah's town. Ton of people from Allatoona go there to do homework or hang out. It's a very rare occasion if Hannah doesn't see someone from school there.

Hannah can't help it - she's too curious and too upset to ignore what's going on. Hannah goes on twitter and sees that Willa has made a post about her. She called Hannah really terrible names. The worst part was the amount of people who liked it or  retweeted it. People that Hannah thought were her friends were now taking part in making fun of her.
Hannah made a mistake when she got in Frankie and Willa's business. She just wants this to be over and for people to stop talking about her.

The next day at school was really hard. It seemed like everyone was talking about her. People she usually hung out with kept their distance. Hannah felt like everyone had turned on her, like no one liked her anymore. She felt like there was nothing she could do.
After English class
Mr. Hoffman
asked Hannah to stay behind. Once everyone had left the room, he asked if everything was alright. He said it seemed like Hannah was not her usual self.
What should Hannah do?
Tell him about Willa
Tell him nothing
If Hannah looks at the posts she's going to get really mad and she might post something to make things worse. Since trying to distract herself didn't work, it might be helpful to talk about it.
She texts Meera, but fifteen minutes go by and she hasn't gotten a response. Is she trying to avoid Hannah?

Hannah is getting really upset at this point. It feels like everyone hates her and she has no one to talk to about it. She's so upset that she barely eats anything at dinner. She can't focus on her homework and she spends the whole night tossing and turning.
The next day at school people are quoting some of Willa's tweets and calling Hannah terrible names. No one has ever really been mean to Hannah's face before - she has no idea how to react.
Meera wasn't at school that day, so she ate lunch alone - it was totally humiliating. Right as she was finishing eating
Adam
comes up to talk to her.
How should Hannah react?
Tell him to leave her alone

content.content: Ask him what he wants
Hannah can't take it anymore. She's feeling too stressed about everything. She needs to open up to someone - to anyone, really.
She tells Mr. Hoffman about the mean messages she's been getting and she tells him about how everyone is ignoring her, or worse, making fun of her.
Mr. Hoffman asks what he can do to help. Hannah doesn't know what to say - she was hoping he had answers!

She asks Mr. Hoffman how she can get other students to leave her alone.  He suggests talking to school administration. He said that in the past few years, Allatoona has started taking cases of cyberbullying really seriously. He helps Hannah set up an appointment with
Mr. Grant
Just having a plan makes Hannah feel a lot better. Hopefully the bullying will stop soon.
The End
She can't tell him about Willa. She doesn't want people to think she's a tattletale. Besides, Hannah's so frustrated she doubts she could talk about it all right now.
She tells Mr. Hoffman that she's fine - just tired. He says ok, but Hannah can tell he doesn't believe her.
At home she gets the same question from her
dad
. There's no way she's going to tell him, though. He might freak out and take her phone away.
It feels like there is literally no one she can go to about this problem. At this point Hannah is willing to try anything. The next day she goes to the office to speak with her guidance counselor,
Ms. Miller

She was nervous at first, but after talking for a few minutes Hannah really feels like she can open up to Ms. Miller. She tells her all about what's been going on with the posts. Ms. Miller says that the school takes bullying really seriously.
The two set up time to talk to
Mr. Grant
later that week. Just having a plan makes Hannah feel so much better!
The End

name: Tell him to leave her alone

content.content: Adam is the last person she wants to talk to right now. When he starts talking to her she snaps and tells him to go away. Adam looks startled at Hannah's outburst. Without saying anything he turns around and walks away.
It felt good in the moment, but Hannah realizes that she hurt his feelings. She may not like him very much, but she doesn't want him to feel bad either. Why did she yell at him?
That interaction on top of everything else that's going on made Hannah feel really hopeless. She needs to talk to someone soon because she feels like she's going to explode.
Who should she talk to?
Her dad
Her guidance counselor
Meera
Hannah asks Adam why he's coming over to talk to her. He says that he saw the posts that had been made about Hannah. He said he just wants to check in and see if she's doing alright.
Wow. Hannah doesn't even know him that well - it's pretty nice of him to see if she's alright. Hannah's kind of surprised at how she opens up to Adam. She tells him the whole story more or less.

He shares that he's been bullied too. He says that he tried ignoring it and it didn't stop, he told the bullies to leave him alone and they just laughed. He said the only thing that actually helped him was using this thing called
OK2Say
He offered to show Hannah how it works after school.
What should she do?
Accept his help
Tell him no

Ms. Miller
tomorrow about what she's been going through.

about this. If she tells her dad he'll just freak out and she doesn't think Meera will know what to do.

guidance counselor
After thinking about it for a while Hannah thinks it's a good idea - just having a plan makes things easier!

dad
. She shares everything that has been going on with Frankie and how everyone at school is being mean to her. The whole situation has made her feel worthless and crushingly sad.

She expected her dad to freak out - to take her phone - maybe even go to the school and make a scene, but the way he reacted really surprised her. He was really calm, he asked her questions, and then asked if he could help.
At first Hannah felt really stupid going to her dad - like she was a baby or something, but they were able to make a plan to help.
Her dad suggested that she shut down her accounts for a little while and talk to someone at school. At this point Hannah is willing to try anything. She plans on talking to
Ms. Miller
tomorrow about what she's been going through.

Hannah's dad is like the classic dad. His jokes are pretty terrible, but that doesn't stop him from making them. Hannah loves him, but she doesn't always feel comfortable telling him about her life.
assets/mod2/miller.png
Ms. Miller is Hannah's guidance counselor. Hannah doesn't know her too well, but Ms. Miller has been super friendly. She seems like the kind of person Hannah can trust.
Hannah has had enough of being bullied. If something doesn't happen soon to end it, she feels like she's going to die.
She meets up with Adam after school and he shows her the site. Making a report was actually really easy. She took some screenshots of the tweets, entered in some lines of info, and sent it off.

Hannah feels pretty optimistic about this - just making the report brightened her day a little bit. The only things left to do is to sit back and wait. At least she knows now that //everyone// doesn't hate her.
The End
Hannah thanks him for being so nice, but she wants to handle things herself. She's not so sure she wants to make a report. She'll just wait and see if things get better in the next few days.

A few days go by and things do start to get a little bit better. She notices that people have started being mean to someone else now. Hannah feels relieved, but also a little guilty for feeling that way.
After thinking about it for a while, she decides that she's going to make a report. She doesn't want anyone else to go through what she had to.
She decides to go talk to
Mr. Grant
about what's been going on. On her way she sees a poster for something called
OK2Say
. This seems like it could be helpful.
How should Hannah make the report?
In person
Using OK2Say
The End

This module was intended to illustrate the ease in which people can get caught up in cyberbullying - whether it's a way of getting revenge, to make friends laugh, or to make yourself feel better. Nearly half of all teens are cyberbullied at one point or another - and there can be serious, long-lasting consequences. It's our job as a community to make sure there are as few instances of cyberbullying as possible.
Good job getting help when you needed it. Shutting down an account can be tough, but sometimes it's the right thing to do.

if you want to go back and explore a different path.
Visit ok2say.org to make a report if you or someone you know is being cyberbullied.

That night the two are talking about how weird that party was. Hannah tells Meera that she called 911. Meera totally agrees that Hannah did the right thing. Unfortunately, not everyone shares their view point.
Pretty soon their social media feeds are filled with people complaining about the police showing up, talking about how much trouble they're in, or talking about who they think made the call.
It's not long before Angelica tweets
this
What should Hannah do?
Cop to it
Ignore it
Everyone is being a bystander. This guy could be dying and we're just watching him. Hannah has to do something.

She pushes her way through the crowd and kneels next to him. She looks closely and can see that he's breathing. She pokes him and he rolls over. It seems like he's ok, but just to be sure she pulls him forward and places him in recovery position. She then stands up and realizes that everyone has been taking pictures and videos of her!

It's not long before she gets a notification from Instagram. Ugh! People have tagged pictures of her and that guy! The angle of the picture makes it look totally inappropriate - and people are already liking it and writing nasty comments!
Hannah is so upset that she leaves the party. All night her phone is blowing up. How can people make fun of her like that?
What should Hannah do?
Tell everyone to stop
Ignore it
This party is a little too intense for Hannah, she grabs Meera, turns around and makes a bee line for the door.

Hannah and Meera get a
text
from Angelica.

this one
from Willa.
This is terrible! Everyone is being so mean. Hannah feels overwhelmed. There's too much going on! Luckily Meera has a plan.

OK2Say
to get the bullying to stop.
It's worth a shot. They take some screenshots of the messages and make a report. Within 10 minutes they're all finished up.
The mean messages are still coming in, but by Monday night they've stopped.

made an announcement telling the whole school that he had received confidential reports about cyberbullying. He said he would be calling people into the office to talk about it throughout the day.
Hannah is so relieved that this worked! It feels like a weight has been lifted off of her!
